title: 115_hr6444
content: Capital Gains Inflation Relief Act This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow the adjusted basis of certain assets to be indexed for inflation for the purpose of determining the gain or loss of a taxpayer who has held the asset for more than three years. The bill sets forth rules for applying the inflation adjustment to: short sales, regulated investment companies, real estate investment trusts. Other pass-through entities, including partnerships, S corporations, and common trust funds, dispositions between related persons. And improvements to property or contributions of capital. The Internal Revenue Service may disallow an adjustment if any person transfers cash, debt, or any other property to another person for the principal purpose of securing or increasing the adjustment allowed by this bill.
